name: oauth2-proxy
description: OAuth2 Proxy is a reverse proxy that provides authentication using OAuth2 providers like Google or GitHub. It sits in front of apps to enforce login without modifying their code; suitable for self-hosted setups.
features: OAuth2 authentication: Protect applications by requiring login through Google, GitHub, GitLab, or other OAuth providers.
Reverse proxy: Sit in front of existing applications to add authentication without modifying their source code.
Email whitelisting: Restrict access to specific email addresses or domains for controlled user authorization.
Session management: Maintain user sessions with configurable timeouts and automatic token refresh for seamless access.
Header injection: Pass user information to backend applications via HTTP headers for identity-aware features.
Multiple providers: Support various OAuth2 and OIDC providers simultaneously for flexible authentication options.
TLS termination: Handle HTTPS connections and certificate management at the proxy layer for simplified deployment.
Kubernetes integration: Deploy as an ingress controller or sidecar container for cloud-native authentication patterns.
